posts.cooked:
Hi All,

I put this story in this section don‚Äôt know if it‚Äôs the right one but for now I think it does,

I use WhatsApp for a long time. Dumped Facebook a long time ago, and now I wanted to do the same with this WhatsApp. So I told all my WhatsApp users I will be moving to Signal. A lot did install the Signal app but the important ones did not.

Now I found that all of these WhatsApp users have a business and use WhatsApp business edition. So I looked for the Signal business edition and there seems to be none‚Ä¶

This is a big problem because that means in the end that people will return to WhatsApp to communicate with these businesses.

For example, I connect to my drugstore with WhatsApp. I order my food the same way at my diner. I connect to my work company and colleagues with it because Signal has no Business edition.

How to get these on Signal?

link_counts.title: Hey, remember the trusted old - Enterprise Level Security - Enterprise Design - Blackberry Messenger?
Why do people avoid using WhatsApp?

posts.cooked:
I think this is relevant but it will take time. Is WhatsApp the only way to communicate with these businesses? They might have added that contact route only because WhatsApp is so prevalent. Until Signal is at least similarly popular, I wouldn‚Äôt see normal businesses adding it. It also depends on if the business WhatsApp version has an interface to business applications to streamline logging orders and such.

In the very least, having a Signal web link would help, and this has been suggested a few times here already.

Correct, a web login would be a nice addition for businesses to print or rank orders. Installing an app does not work on thin client, chromebook or other equipment. But al other options in the business app are needed to change them.

I think This site shows the important of it:

blog.hubspot.com

The Ultimate Guide to Using WhatsApp for Business in 2021

Discover how to use WhatsApp as a tool to elevate customer relationships, increase leads, and builds brand awareness in 2021.

link_counts.title: The Ultimate Guide to Using WhatsApp for Business in 2021

posts.cooked:
I don‚Äôt think @SignalTheFuture meant a web login but this topic:

Add custom url scheme signal:// or sgnl:// for share or call buttons on websites Feature Requests
I maintain a website, and I would love to put signal share buttons on my articles. To do so, there needs to be a way to point to the signal app from webpages. The manner to do this without many compatibility issues is a custom url sceme: signal:// I know, custom url scemes could be considered bad practice since they pollude the namespace. I agree, but for now signal can‚Äôt compete with other social media from a buisness standpoint because of missing features like these. This may keep a lot of pe‚Ä¶

Even though, this could be interesting for businesses, I never ordered something via WhatsApp. I only know one company which offers tech support via WhatsApp (one of the big national telcos) but I never used it. I think, people using Signal are not that interested in doing this rather than opening the website. Just my two cents.

posts.cooked:
More and more Companies are using Chat messaging for connecting with clients.
E.g. Adidas only has a WhatsApp chat Option nothing else not even a email anymore.

I think it makes sense to Implement a functionality for business to use signal to connect with their clients.
There are two options for implementation:

    • With a Phone number normal at the Phone.
      Every business just needs a Phone number and can download the app and use it with there phone number. They can change in the Settings from Personal account to business account.
      (Easy to implement)(maybe even business verification)
    • Signal Business Accounts
      A dashboard or separate app for companies to manage there chats. They don‚Äôt have to have a Phone number also email or name works?
      Perfect would be also an API to connect bot services to the signal chats.
      And also the functionality to implement this into the Website from the Company.
      Maybe even a open source library for business verification‚Ä¶

What are your thoughts?

posts.cooked: Signal is non-profit, and the app that exists is their one product, so how would Signal for business differentiate from consumer Signal? There‚Äôd be no tier pricing, business contracts etc.

There is no real difference‚Ä¶
The only real difference is in the chat, e.g. next to the Name, is written, that it is a business account. Maybe we could create an implementation for verification of these business Accounts‚Ä¶
Just that u know you write with the real business‚Ä¶

like the group chat.

Even as Acton has publicly urged users to get off Facebook, in our conversation he did not suggest that people should stop using WhatsApp. On the contrary, Acton said he envisions people relying on Signal for conversations with their family and close friends, and using WhatsApp for other chats. ‚ÄúI have no desire to do all the things that WhatsApp does. My desire is to give people a choice,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúOtherwise, you‚Äôre locked into something where you have no choice. It‚Äôs not strictly a winner take-all scenario.‚Äù

Wouldn‚Äôt it make more sense for a company to take all the open-source code and make their own app? Since Signal is non-profit, what would be their incentive to take on all the additional resource costs to do this?

I‚Äôm still struggling to find an incentive for Signal to do this without a profit-motive.

I asked what is the most important option from WAB and the answer I got from these businesses is: It replaces our website for a big part. We can make a page telling when we are open and closed. Do not forget the impotants of the ‚Äúout of office reply‚Äù option for emloyees and the possibility to put in URL links to important sales\sites or putting in extra support options for customers.

posts.cooked:
For consumers WhatsApp Business offers also an very important function:

The possibility to use two numbers on one phone with WhatsApp (and WA Business). A function you really needs when you have dual sim.

This is something I really hate about Signal, that this still isn‚Äôt possible. Also more and more people have dual sim so I hope this will be a top priority as soon as possible.

posts.name: mattie
posts.cooked:
Avitus:

Since Signal is non-profit, what would be their incentive to take on all the additional resource costs to do this?

Non-profit doesn‚Äôt mean you cant charge for goods or services. It just means profits must be reinvested not taken by shareholders etc. So the incentive could be business side could be used to subsidize the cost of the non-business side.
10 posts were split to a new topic: Why do people avoid using WhatsApp?

link_counts.title: Why do people avoid using WhatsApp?

posts.cooked:
Brazil is surely one of the largest countries where Whatsapp dominates and here is my experience:

  • Almost every business have a Whatsapp, its not exaggeration, if they negotiate with clients and don‚Äôt need to show stylish photos (Intagram), I assure you they have a Whatsapp to contact.
  • Big business like banks and food delivery apps almost only uses it as a notification delivery or helpdesk (bot) from Whatsapp, which is incredibly expensive.
  • Small business like convenience store or restaurants only use it as a ordinary account, with the special badge to indicate it‚Äôs a business account. I never saw any of them using special features like menus or product catalog.

So in my opinion even if Signal doesn‚Äôt want to enter the Business thing, the most important feature would be supporting some API properly like Telegram so companies can at least try something themselves. (see also Add bots, like in Telegram)
